Language Exchange Program: Encourage students to pair up with a foreign exchange student and engage in regular language exchanges where they can practice speaking each other's languages. This will not only help them improve their language skills but also provide an opportunity for cultural exchange.

Cultural Immersion Day: Organize a day where students can explore different aspects of the foreign exchange student's culture. This could include trying traditional foods, learning about customs and traditions, or participating in cultural activities such as music or dance.

Volunteer Project: Pair the foreign exchange student with a local community organization and have them work on a volunteer project together. This will give both students the opportunity to make a positive impact while also building relationships and gaining valuable experience.

Host Family Experience: Have the foreign exchange student stay with a host family who is willing to share their home and culture with them. This will provide a more immersive experience for the exchange student and allow them to get a better sense of what life is like in the host country.

Student-led Conference: Organize a conference where students can present on topics related to the foreign exchange program. This could include sharing their experiences, discussing cultural differences, or presenting research on international education. It will be a great way for all students involved to learn from each other and gain new perspectives.
